APIVersion.name: APIVersion
APIVersion.description: The Amazon CloudSearch API version for a domain: 2011-02-01 or 2013-01-01.

ARN.name: ARN
ARN.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the search domain. See Identifiers for IAM Entities in Using AWS Identity and Access Management for more information.

AnalysisSchemeLanguage.name: AnalysisSchemeLanguage
AnalysisSchemeLanguage.description: An IETF RFC 4646 language code or mul for multiple languages.

AnalysisSchemeStatusList.name: AnalysisSchemeStatusList
AnalysisSchemeStatusList.description: A list of the analysis schemes configured for a domain.

DomainId.name: DomainId
DomainId.description: An internally generated unique identifier for a domain.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: A string that represents the name of a domain. Domain names are unique across the domains owned by an account within an AWS region. Domain names start with a letter or number and can contain the following characters: a-z (lowercase), 0-9, and - (hyphen).

DomainStatusList.name: DomainStatusList
DomainStatusList.description: A list that contains the status of each requested domain.

ExpressionValue.name: ExpressionValue
ExpressionValue.description: The expression to evaluate for sorting while processing a search request. The Expression syntax is based on JavaScript expressions. For more information, see Configuring Expressions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

FieldName.name: FieldName
FieldName.description:
A string that represents the name of an index field. CloudSearch supports regular index fields as well as dynamic fields. A dynamic field's name defines a pattern that begins or ends with a wildcard. Any document fields that don't map to a regular index field but do match a dynamic field's pattern are configured with the dynamic field's indexing options.

Regular field names begin with a letter and can contain the following characters: a-z (lowercase), 0-9, and _ (underscore). Dynamic field names must begin or end with a wildcard (*). The wildcard can also be the only character in a dynamic field name. Multiple wildcards, and wildcards embedded within a string are not supported.

The name score is reserved and cannot be used as a field name. To reference a document's ID, you can use the name _id.

IndexFieldStatusList.name: IndexFieldStatusList
IndexFieldStatusList.description: Contains the status of multiple index fields.

IndexFieldType.name: IndexFieldType
IndexFieldType.description: The type of field. The valid options for a field depend on the field type. For more information about the supported field types, see Configuring Index Fields in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

OptionState.name: OptionState
OptionState.description:
The state of processing a change to an option. One of:

  • RequiresIndexDocuments: The option's latest value will not be deployed until IndexDocuments has been called and indexing is complete.
  • Processing: The option's latest value is in the process of being activated.
  • Active: The option's latest value is fully deployed.
  • FailedToValidate: The option value is not compatible with the domain's data and cannot be used to index the data. You must either modify the option value or update or remove the incompatible documents.

PartitionCount.name: PartitionCount
PartitionCount.description: The number of partitions used to hold the domain's index.

PartitionInstanceType.name: PartitionInstanceType
PartitionInstanceType.description: The instance type (such as search.m1.small) on which an index partition is hosted.

PolicyDocument.name: PolicyDocument
PolicyDocument.description: Access rules for a domain's document or search service endpoints. For more information, see Configuring Access for a Search Domain in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide. The maximum size of a policy document is 100 KB.

SearchInstanceType.name: SearchInstanceType
SearchInstanceType.description: The instance type (such as search.m1.small) that is being used to process search requests.

ServiceUrl.name: ServiceUrl
ServiceUrl.description: The endpoint to which service requests can be submitted. For example, search-imdb-movies-oopcnjfn6ugofer3zx5iadxxca.eu-west-1.cloudsearch.amazonaws.com or doc-imdb-movies-oopcnjfn6ugofer3zx5iadxxca.eu-west-1.cloudsearch.amazonaws.com.

StandardName.name: StandardName
StandardName.description: Names must begin with a letter and can contain the following characters: a-z (lowercase), 0-9, and _ (underscore).

AccessPoliciesStatus.name: AccessPoliciesStatus
AccessPoliciesStatus.description: The configured access rules for the domain's document and search endpoints, and the current status of those rules.

AnalysisOptions.name: AnalysisOptions
AnalysisOptions.description: Synonyms, stopwords, and stemming options for an analysis scheme. Includes tokenization dictionary for Japanese.

Synonyms.name: Synonyms
Synonyms.description: A JSON object that defines synonym groups and aliases. A synonym group is an array of arrays, where each sub-array is a group of terms where each term in the group is considered a synonym of every other term in the group. The aliases value is an object that contains a collection of string:value pairs where the string specifies a term and the array of values specifies each of the aliases for that term. An alias is considered a synonym of the specified term, but the term is not considered a synonym of the alias. For more information about specifying synonyms, see Synonyms in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

Stopwords.name: Stopwords
Stopwords.description: A JSON array of terms to ignore during indexing and searching. For example, ["a", "an", "the", "of"]. The stopwords dictionary must explicitly list each word you want to ignore. Wildcards and regular expressions are not supported.

StemmingDictionary.name: StemmingDictionary
StemmingDictionary.description: A JSON object that contains a collection of string:value pairs that each map a term to its stem. For example, {"term1": "stem1", "term2": "stem2", "term3": "stem3"}. The stemming dictionary is applied in addition to any algorithmic stemming. This enables you to override the results of the algorithmic stemming to correct specific cases of overstemming or understemming. The maximum size of a stemming dictionary is 500 KB.

JapaneseTokenizationDictionary.name: JapaneseTokenizationDictionary
JapaneseTokenizationDictionary.description: A JSON array that contains a collection of terms, tokens, readings and part of speech for Japanese Tokenizaiton. The Japanese tokenization dictionary enables you to override the default tokenization for selected terms. This is only valid for Japanese language fields.

AlgorithmicStemming.name: AlgorithmicStemming
AlgorithmicStemming.description: The level of algorithmic stemming to perform: none, minimal, light, or full. The available levels vary depending on the language. For more information, see Language Specific Text Processing Settings in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide

AnalysisScheme.name: AnalysisScheme
AnalysisScheme.description: Configuration information for an analysis scheme. Each analysis scheme has a unique name and specifies the language of the text to be processed. The following options can be configured for an analysis scheme: Synonyms, Stopwords, StemmingDictionary, JapaneseTokenizationDictionary and AlgorithmicStemming.

AvailabilityOptionsStatus.name: AvailabilityOptionsStatus
AvailabilityOptionsStatus.description: The status and configuration of the domain's availability options.

Options.name: Options
Options.description: The availability options configured for the domain.

BuildSuggestersRequest.name: BuildSuggestersRequest
BuildSuggestersRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the BuildSuggester operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update.

BuildSuggestersResponse.name: BuildSuggestersResponse
BuildSuggestersResponse.description: The result of a BuildSuggester request. Contains a list of the fields used for suggestions.

CreateDomainRequest.name: CreateDomainRequest
CreateDomainRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the CreateDomain operation. Specifies a name for the new search domain.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: A name for the domain you are creating. Allowed characters are a-z (lower-case letters), 0-9, and hyphen (-). Domain names must start with a letter or number and be at least 3 and no more than 28 characters long.

CreateDomainResponse.name: CreateDomainResponse
CreateDomainResponse.description: The result of a CreateDomainRequest. Contains the status of a newly created domain.

DateArrayOptions.name: DateArrayOptions
DateArrayOptions.description: Options for a field that contains an array of dates. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type date-array. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

SourceFields.name: SourceFields
SourceFields.description: A list of source fields to map to the field.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

DateOptions.name: DateOptions
DateOptions.description: Options for a date field. Dates and times are specified in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) according to IETF RFC3339: yyyy-mm-ddT00:00:00Z. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type date. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

SortEnabled.name: SortEnabled
SortEnabled.description: Whether the field can be used to sort the search results.

DefineAnalysisSchemeRequest.name: DefineAnalysisSchemeRequest
DefineAnalysisSchemeRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DefineAnalysisScheme operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the analysis scheme configuration.

DefineAnalysisSchemeResponse.name: DefineAnalysisSchemeResponse
DefineAnalysisSchemeResponse.description: The result of a DefineAnalysisScheme request. Contains the status of the newly-configured analysis scheme.

DefineExpressionRequest.name: DefineExpressionRequest
DefineExpressionRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DefineExpression operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the expression you want to configure.

DefineExpressionResponse.name: DefineExpressionResponse
DefineExpressionResponse.description: The result of a DefineExpression request. Contains the status of the newly-configured expression.

DefineIndexFieldRequest.name: DefineIndexFieldRequest
DefineIndexFieldRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DefineIndexField operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the index field configuration.

IndexField.name: IndexField
IndexField.description: The index field and field options you want to configure.

DefineIndexFieldResponse.name: DefineIndexFieldResponse
DefineIndexFieldResponse.description: The result of a DefineIndexField request. Contains the status of the newly-configured index field.

DefineSuggesterRequest.name: DefineSuggesterRequest
DefineSuggesterRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DefineSuggester operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the suggester configuration.

DefineSuggesterResponse.name: DefineSuggesterResponse
DefineSuggesterResponse.description: The result of a DefineSuggester request. Contains the status of the newly-configured suggester.

DeleteAnalysisSchemeRequest.name: DeleteAnalysisSchemeRequest
DeleteAnalysisSchemeRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DeleteAnalysisScheme operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the analysis scheme you want to delete.

AnalysisSchemeName.name: AnalysisSchemeName
AnalysisSchemeName.description: The name of the analysis scheme you want to delete.

DeleteAnalysisSchemeResponse.name: DeleteAnalysisSchemeResponse
DeleteAnalysisSchemeResponse.description: The result of a DeleteAnalysisScheme request. Contains the status of the deleted analysis scheme.

AnalysisScheme.name: AnalysisScheme
AnalysisScheme.description: The status of the analysis scheme being deleted.

DeleteDomainRequest.name: DeleteDomainRequest
DeleteDomainRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DeleteDomain operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to delete.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to permanently delete.

DeleteDomainResponse.name: DeleteDomainResponse
DeleteDomainResponse.description: The result of a DeleteDomain request. Contains the status of a newly deleted domain, or no status if the domain has already been completely deleted.

DeleteExpressionRequest.name: DeleteExpressionRequest
DeleteExpressionRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DeleteExpression operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the name of the expression you want to delete.

DeleteExpressionResponse.name: DeleteExpressionResponse
DeleteExpressionResponse.description: The result of a DeleteExpression request. Specifies the expression being deleted.

Expression.name: Expression
Expression.description: The status of the expression being deleted.

DeleteIndexFieldRequest.name: DeleteIndexFieldRequest
DeleteIndexFieldRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DeleteIndexField operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the name of the index field you want to delete.

IndexFieldName.name: IndexFieldName
IndexFieldName.description: The name of the index field your want to remove from the domain's indexing options.

IndexField.name: IndexField
IndexField.description: The status of the index field being deleted.

DeleteSuggesterRequest.name: DeleteSuggesterRequest
DeleteSuggesterRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DeleteSuggester operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and name of the suggester you want to delete.

SuggesterName.name: SuggesterName
SuggesterName.description: Specifies the name of the suggester you want to delete.

DeleteSuggesterResponse.name: DeleteSuggesterResponse
DeleteSuggesterResponse.description: The result of a DeleteSuggester request. Contains the status of the deleted suggester.

Suggester.name: Suggester
Suggester.description: The status of the suggester being deleted.

DescribeAnalysisSchemesRequest.name: DescribeAnalysisSchemesRequest
DescribeAnalysisSchemesRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeAnalysisSchemes operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe. To limit the response to particular analysis schemes, specify the names of the analysis schemes you want to describe. To show the active configuration and exclude any pending changes, set the Deployed option to true.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to describe.

AnalysisSchemeNames.name: AnalysisSchemeNames
AnalysisSchemeNames.description: The analysis schemes you want to describe.

Deployed.name: Deployed
Deployed.description: Whether to display the deployed configuration (true) or include any pending changes (false). Defaults to false.

DescribeAnalysisSchemesResponse.name: DescribeAnalysisSchemesResponse
DescribeAnalysisSchemesResponse.description: The result of a DescribeAnalysisSchemes request. Contains the analysis schemes configured for the domain specified in the request.

DescribeAvailabilityOptionsRequest.name: DescribeAvailabilityOptionsRequest
DescribeAvailabilityOptionsRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeAvailabilityOptions operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe. To show the active configuration and exclude any pending changes, set the Deployed option to true.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to describe.

Deployed.name: Deployed
Deployed.description: Whether to display the deployed configuration (true) or include any pending changes (false). Defaults to false.

DescribeAvailabilityOptionsResponse.name: DescribeAvailabilityOptionsResponse
DescribeAvailabilityOptionsResponse.description: The result of a DescribeAvailabilityOptions request. Indicates whether or not the Multi-AZ option is enabled for the domain specified in the request.

AvailabilityOptions.name: AvailabilityOptions
AvailabilityOptions.description: The availability options configured for the domain. Indicates whether Multi-AZ is enabled for the domain.

DescribeDomainsRequest.name: DescribeDomainsRequest
DescribeDomainsRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeDomains operation. By default shows the status of all domains. To restrict the response to particular domains, specify the names of the domains you want to describe.

DomainNames.name: DomainNames
DomainNames.description: The names of the domains you want to include in the response.

DescribeDomainsResponse.name: DescribeDomainsResponse
DescribeDomainsResponse.description: The result of a DescribeDomains request. Contains the status of the domains specified in the request or all domains owned by the account.

DescribeExpressionsRequest.name: DescribeExpressionsRequest
DescribeExpressionsRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeDomains operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe. To restrict the response to particular expressions, specify the names of the expressions you want to describe. To show the active configuration and exclude any pending changes, set the Deployed option to true.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to describe.

ExpressionNames.name: ExpressionNames
ExpressionNames.description: Limits the DescribeExpressions response to the specified expressions. If not specified, all expressions are shown.

Deployed.name: Deployed
Deployed.description: Whether to display the deployed configuration (true) or include any pending changes (false). Defaults to false.

DescribeExpressionsResponse.name: DescribeExpressionsResponse
DescribeExpressionsResponse.description: The result of a DescribeExpressions request. Contains the expressions configured for the domain specified in the request.

DescribeIndexFieldsRequest.name: DescribeIndexFieldsRequest
DescribeIndexFieldsRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeIndexFields operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe. To restrict the response to particular index fields, specify the names of the index fields you want to describe. To show the active configuration and exclude any pending changes, set the Deployed option to true.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to describe.

FieldNames.name: FieldNames
FieldNames.description: A list of the index fields you want to describe. If not specified, information is returned for all configured index fields.

Deployed.name: Deployed
Deployed.description: Whether to display the deployed configuration (true) or include any pending changes (false). Defaults to false.

DescribeIndexFieldsResponse.name: DescribeIndexFieldsResponse
DescribeIndexFieldsResponse.description: The result of a DescribeIndexFields request. Contains the index fields configured for the domain specified in the request.

IndexFields.name: IndexFields
IndexFields.description: The index fields configured for the domain.

DescribeScalingParametersRequest.name: DescribeScalingParametersRequest
DescribeScalingParametersRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeScalingParameters operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe.

DescribeScalingParametersResponse.name: DescribeScalingParametersResponse
DescribeScalingParametersResponse.description: The result of a DescribeScalingParameters request. Contains the scaling parameters configured for the domain specified in the request.

DescribeServiceAccessPoliciesRequest.name: DescribeServiceAccessPoliciesRequest
DescribeServiceAccessPoliciesRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeServiceAccessPolicies operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe. To show the active configuration and exclude any pending changes, set the Deployed option to true.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to describe.

Deployed.name: Deployed
Deployed.description: Whether to display the deployed configuration (true) or include any pending changes (false). Defaults to false.

AccessPolicies.name: AccessPolicies
AccessPolicies.description: The access rules configured for the domain specified in the request.

DescribeSuggestersRequest.name: DescribeSuggestersRequest
DescribeSuggestersRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the DescribeSuggester operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to describe. To restrict the response to particular suggesters, specify the names of the suggesters you want to describe. To show the active configuration and exclude any pending changes, set the Deployed option to true.

DomainName.name: DomainName
DomainName.description: The name of the domain you want to describe.

Deployed.name: Deployed
Deployed.description: Whether to display the deployed configuration (true) or include any pending changes (false). Defaults to false.

Suggesters.name: Suggesters
Suggesters.description: The suggesters configured for the domain specified in the request.

SourceField.name: SourceField
SourceField.description: The name of the index field you want to use for suggestions.

FuzzyMatching.name: FuzzyMatching
FuzzyMatching.description: The level of fuzziness allowed when suggesting matches for a string: none, low, or high. With none, the specified string is treated as an exact prefix. With low, suggestions must differ from the specified string by no more than one character. With high, suggestions can differ by up to two characters. The default is none.

SortExpression.name: SortExpression
SortExpression.description: An expression that computes a score for each suggestion to control how they are sorted. The scores are rounded to the nearest integer, with a floor of 0 and a ceiling of 2^31-1. A document's relevance score is not computed for suggestions, so sort expressions cannot reference the _score value. To sort suggestions using a numeric field or existing expression, simply specify the name of the field or expression. If no expression is configured for the suggester, the suggestions are sorted with the closest matches listed first.

DomainStatus.name: DomainStatus
DomainStatus.description: The current status of the search domain.

Created.name: Created
Created.description: True if the search domain is created. It can take several minutes to initialize a domain when CreateDomain is called. Newly created search domains are returned from DescribeDomains with a false value for Created until domain creation is complete.

Deleted.name: Deleted
Deleted.description: True if the search domain has been deleted. The system must clean up resources dedicated to the search domain when DeleteDomain is called. Newly deleted search domains are returned from DescribeDomains with a true value for IsDeleted for several minutes until resource cleanup is complete.

DocService.name: DocService
DocService.description: The service endpoint for updating documents in a search domain.

SearchService.name: SearchService
SearchService.description: The service endpoint for requesting search results from a search domain.

RequiresIndexDocuments.name: RequiresIndexDocuments
RequiresIndexDocuments.description: True if IndexDocuments needs to be called to activate the current domain configuration.

Processing.name: Processing
Processing.description: True if processing is being done to activate the current domain configuration.

SearchInstanceType.name: SearchInstanceType
SearchInstanceType.description: The instance type that is being used to process search requests.

SearchPartitionCount.name: SearchPartitionCount
SearchPartitionCount.description: The number of partitions across which the search index is spread.

SearchInstanceCount.name: SearchInstanceCount
SearchInstanceCount.description: The number of search instances that are available to process search requests.

DoubleArrayOptions.name: DoubleArrayOptions
DoubleArrayOptions.description: Options for a field that contains an array of double-precision 64-bit floating point values. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type double-array. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

SourceFields.name: SourceFields
SourceFields.description: A list of source fields to map to the field.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

DoubleOptions.name: DoubleOptions
DoubleOptions.description: Options for a double-precision 64-bit floating point field. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type double. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document. This can be important if you are using the field in an expression and that field is not present in every document.

SourceField.name: SourceField
SourceField.description: The name of the source field to map to the field.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

SortEnabled.name: SortEnabled
SortEnabled.description: Whether the field can be used to sort the search results.

Expression.name: Expression
Expression.description: A named expression that can be evaluated at search time. Can be used to sort the search results, define other expressions, or return computed information in the search results.

ExpressionStatus.name: ExpressionStatus
ExpressionStatus.description: The value of an Expression and its current status.

Options.name: Options
Options.description: The expression that is evaluated for sorting while processing a search request.

IndexDocumentsRequest.name: IndexDocumentsRequest
IndexDocumentsRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the IndexDocuments operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to re-index.

IndexDocumentsResponse.name: IndexDocumentsResponse
IndexDocumentsResponse.description: The result of an IndexDocuments request. Contains the status of the indexing operation, including the fields being indexed.

FieldNames.name: FieldNames
FieldNames.description: The names of the fields that are currently being indexed.

IndexField.name: IndexField
IndexField.description: Configuration information for a field in the index, including its name, type, and options. The supported options depend on the IndexFieldType.

IndexFieldName.name: IndexFieldName
IndexFieldName.description:
A string that represents the name of an index field. CloudSearch supports regular index fields as well as dynamic fields. A dynamic field's name defines a pattern that begins or ends with a wildcard. Any document fields that don't map to a regular index field but do match a dynamic field's pattern are configured with the dynamic field's indexing options.

Regular field names begin with a letter and can contain the following characters: a-z (lowercase), 0-9, and _ (underscore). Dynamic field names must begin or end with a wildcard (*). The wildcard can also be the only character in a dynamic field name. Multiple wildcards, and wildcards embedded within a string are not supported.

The name score is reserved and cannot be used as a field name. To reference a document's ID, you can use the name _id.

IndexFieldStatus.name: IndexFieldStatus
IndexFieldStatus.description: The value of an IndexField and its current status.

IntArrayOptions.name: IntArrayOptions
IntArrayOptions.description: Options for a field that contains an array of 64-bit signed integers. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type int-array. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

SourceFields.name: SourceFields
SourceFields.description: A list of source fields to map to the field.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

IntOptions.name: IntOptions
IntOptions.description: Options for a 64-bit signed integer field. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type int. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document. This can be important if you are using the field in an expression and that field is not present in every document.

SourceField.name: SourceField
SourceField.description: The name of the source field to map to the field.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

SortEnabled.name: SortEnabled
SortEnabled.description: Whether the field can be used to sort the search results.

LatLonOptions.name: LatLonOptions
LatLonOptions.description: Options for a latlon field. A latlon field contains a location stored as a latitude and longitude value pair. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type latlon. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

SortEnabled.name: SortEnabled
SortEnabled.description: Whether the field can be used to sort the search results.

ListDomainNamesResponse.name: ListDomainNamesResponse
ListDomainNamesResponse.description: The result of a ListDomainNames request. Contains a list of the domains owned by an account.

DomainNames.name: DomainNames
DomainNames.description: The names of the search domains owned by an account.

LiteralArrayOptions.name: LiteralArrayOptions
LiteralArrayOptions.description: Options for a field that contains an array of literal strings. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type literal-array. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

SourceFields.name: SourceFields
SourceFields.description: A list of source fields to map to the field.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

LiteralOptions.name: LiteralOptions
LiteralOptions.description: Options for literal field. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type literal. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

FacetEnabled.name: FacetEnabled
FacetEnabled.description: Whether facet information can be returned for the field.

SearchEnabled.name: SearchEnabled
SearchEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field are searchable.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

SortEnabled.name: SortEnabled
SortEnabled.description: Whether the field can be used to sort the search results.

CreationDate.name: CreationDate
CreationDate.description: A timestamp for when this option was created.

UpdateDate.name: UpdateDate
UpdateDate.description: A timestamp for when this option was last updated.

UpdateVersion.name: UpdateVersion
UpdateVersion.description: A unique integer that indicates when this option was last updated.

State.name: State
State.description:
The state of processing a change to an option. Possible values:

  • RequiresIndexDocuments: the option's latest value will not be deployed until IndexDocuments has been called and indexing is complete.
  • Processing: the option's latest value is in the process of being activated.
  • Active: the option's latest value is completely deployed.
  • FailedToValidate: the option value is not compatible with the domain's data and cannot be used to index the data. You must either modify the option value or update or remove the incompatible documents.

PendingDeletion.name: PendingDeletion
PendingDeletion.description: Indicates that the option will be deleted once processing is complete.

ScalingParameters.name: ScalingParameters
ScalingParameters.description: The desired instance type and desired number of replicas of each index partition.

DesiredInstanceType.name: DesiredInstanceType
DesiredInstanceType.description: The instance type that you want to preconfigure for your domain. For example, search.m1.small.

DesiredReplicationCount.name: DesiredReplicationCount
DesiredReplicationCount.description: The number of replicas you want to preconfigure for each index partition.

DesiredPartitionCount.name: DesiredPartitionCount
DesiredPartitionCount.description: The number of partitions you want to preconfigure for your domain. Only valid when you select m2.2xlarge as the desired instance type.

ScalingParametersStatus.name: ScalingParametersStatus
ScalingParametersStatus.description: The status and configuration of a search domain's scaling parameters.

ServiceEndpoint.name: ServiceEndpoint
ServiceEndpoint.description: The endpoint to which service requests can be submitted.

Suggester.name: Suggester
Suggester.description: Configuration information for a search suggester. Each suggester has a unique name and specifies the text field you want to use for suggestions. The following options can be configured for a suggester: FuzzyMatching, SortExpression.

SuggesterStatus.name: SuggesterStatus
SuggesterStatus.description: The value of a Suggester and its current status.

TextArrayOptions.name: TextArrayOptions
TextArrayOptions.description: Options for a field that contains an array of text strings. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type text-array. A text-array field is always searchable. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

SourceFields.name: SourceFields
SourceFields.description: A list of source fields to map to the field.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

HighlightEnabled.name: HighlightEnabled
HighlightEnabled.description: Whether highlights can be returned for the field.

AnalysisScheme.name: AnalysisScheme
AnalysisScheme.description: The name of an analysis scheme for a text-array field.

TextOptions.name: TextOptions
TextOptions.description: Options for text field. Present if IndexFieldType specifies the field is of type text. A text field is always searchable. All options are enabled by default.

DefaultValue.name: DefaultValue
DefaultValue.description: A value to use for the field if the field isn't specified for a document.

ReturnEnabled.name: ReturnEnabled
ReturnEnabled.description: Whether the contents of the field can be returned in the search results.

SortEnabled.name: SortEnabled
SortEnabled.description: Whether the field can be used to sort the search results.

HighlightEnabled.name: HighlightEnabled
HighlightEnabled.description: Whether highlights can be returned for the field.

AnalysisScheme.name: AnalysisScheme
AnalysisScheme.description: The name of an analysis scheme for a text field.

UpdateAvailabilityOptionsRequest.name: UpdateAvailabilityOptionsRequest
UpdateAvailabilityOptionsRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the UpdateAvailabilityOptions operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the Multi-AZ availability option.

MultiAZ.name: MultiAZ
MultiAZ.description: You expand an existing search domain to a second Availability Zone by setting the Multi-AZ option to true. Similarly, you can turn off the Multi-AZ option to downgrade the domain to a single Availability Zone by setting the Multi-AZ option to false.

UpdateAvailabilityOptionsResponse.name: UpdateAvailabilityOptionsResponse
UpdateAvailabilityOptionsResponse.description: The result of a UpdateAvailabilityOptions request. Contains the status of the domain's availability options.

AvailabilityOptions.name: AvailabilityOptions
AvailabilityOptions.description: The newly-configured availability options. Indicates whether Multi-AZ is enabled for the domain.

UpdateScalingParametersRequest.name: UpdateScalingParametersRequest
UpdateScalingParametersRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the UpdateScalingParameters operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the scaling parameters you want to configure.

UpdateScalingParametersResponse.name: UpdateScalingParametersResponse
UpdateScalingParametersResponse.description: The result of a UpdateScalingParameters request. Contains the status of the newly-configured scaling parameters.

UpdateServiceAccessPoliciesRequest.name: UpdateServiceAccessPoliciesRequest
UpdateServiceAccessPoliciesRequest.description: Container for the parameters to the UpdateServiceAccessPolicies operation. Specifies the name of the domain you want to update and the access rules you want to configure.

AccessPolicies.name: AccessPolicies
AccessPolicies.description: The access rules you want to configure. These rules replace any existing rules.

UpdateServiceAccessPoliciesResponse.name: UpdateServiceAccessPoliciesResponse
UpdateServiceAccessPoliciesResponse.description: The result of an UpdateServiceAccessPolicies request. Contains the new access policies.

AccessPolicies.name: AccessPolicies
AccessPolicies.description: The access rules configured for the domain.

title: Amazon CloudSearch
description: You use the Amazon CloudSearch configuration service to create, configure, and manage search domains. Configuration service requests are submitted using the AWS Query protocol. AWS Query requests are HTTP or HTTPS requests submitted via HTTP GET or POST with a query parameter named Action. The endpoint for configuration service requests is region-specific: cloudsearch.region.amazonaws.com. For example, cloudsearch.us-east-1.amazonaws.com. For a current list of supported regions and endpoints, see Regions and Endpoints.

methods.description: Indexes the search suggestions. For more information, see Configuring Suggesters in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

BuildSuggesters.name: BuildSuggesters
BuildSuggesters.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Creates a new search domain. For more information, see Creating a Search Domain in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

CreateDomain.name: CreateDomain
CreateDomain.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures an analysis scheme that can be applied to a text or text-array field to define language-specific text processing options. For more information, see Configuring Analysis Schemes in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DefineAnalysisScheme.name: DefineAnalysisScheme
DefineAnalysisScheme.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures an Expression for the search domain. Used to create new expressions and modify existing ones. If the expression exists, the new configuration replaces the old one. For more information, see Configuring Expressions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DefineExpression.name: DefineExpression
DefineExpression.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures an IndexField for the search domain. Used to create new fields and modify existing ones. You must specify the name of the domain you are configuring and an index field configuration. The index field configuration specifies a unique name, the index field type, and the options you want to configure for the field. The options you can specify depend on the IndexFieldType. If the field exists, the new configuration replaces the old one. For more information, see Configuring Index Fields in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DefineIndexField.name: DefineIndexField
DefineIndexField.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures a suggester for a domain. A suggester enables you to display possible matches before users finish typing their queries. When you configure a suggester, you must specify the name of the text field you want to search for possible matches and a unique name for the suggester. For more information, see Getting Search Suggestions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DefineSuggester.name: DefineSuggester
DefineSuggester.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Deletes an analysis scheme. For more information, see Configuring Analysis Schemes in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DeleteAnalysisScheme.name: DeleteAnalysisScheme
DeleteAnalysisScheme.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Permanently deletes a search domain and all of its data. Once a domain has been deleted, it cannot be recovered. For more information, see Deleting a Search Domain in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DeleteDomain.name: DeleteDomain
DeleteDomain.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Removes an Expression from the search domain. For more information, see Configuring Expressions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DeleteExpression.name: DeleteExpression
DeleteExpression.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Removes an IndexField from the search domain. For more information, see Configuring Index Fields in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DeleteIndexField.name: DeleteIndexField
DeleteIndexField.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Deletes a suggester. For more information, see Getting Search Suggestions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DeleteSuggester.name: DeleteSuggester
DeleteSuggester.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets the analysis schemes configured for a domain. An analysis scheme defines language-specific text processing options for a text field. Can be limited to specific analysis schemes by name. By default, shows all analysis schemes and includes any pending changes to the configuration. Set the Deployed option to true to show the active configuration and exclude pending changes. For more information, see Configuring Analysis Schemes in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeAnalysisSchemes.name: DescribeAnalysisSchemes
DescribeAnalysisSchemes.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets the availability options configured for a domain. By default, shows the configuration with any pending changes. Set the Deployed option to true to show the active configuration and exclude pending changes. For more information, see Configuring Availability Options in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeAvailabilityOptions.name: DescribeAvailabilityOptions
DescribeAvailabilityOptions.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets information about the search domains owned by this account. Can be limited to specific domains. Shows all domains by default. To get the number of searchable documents in a domain, use the console or submit a matchall request to your domain's search endpoint: q=matchall&q.parser=structured&size=0. For more information, see Getting Information about a Search Domain in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeDomains.name: DescribeDomains
DescribeDomains.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets the expressions configured for the search domain. Can be limited to specific expressions by name. By default, shows all expressions and includes any pending changes to the configuration. Set the Deployed option to true to show the active configuration and exclude pending changes. For more information, see Configuring Expressions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeExpressions.name: DescribeExpressions
DescribeExpressions.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets information about the index fields configured for the search domain. Can be limited to specific fields by name. By default, shows all fields and includes any pending changes to the configuration. Set the Deployed option to true to show the active configuration and exclude pending changes. For more information, see Getting Domain Information in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeIndexFields.name: DescribeIndexFields
DescribeIndexFields.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets the scaling parameters configured for a domain. A domain's scaling parameters specify the desired search instance type and replication count. For more information, see Configuring Scaling Options in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeScalingParameters.name: DescribeScalingParameters
DescribeScalingParameters.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets information about the access policies that control access to the domain's document and search endpoints. By default, shows the configuration with any pending changes. Set the Deployed option to true to show the active configuration and exclude pending changes. For more information, see Configuring Access for a Search Domain in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeServiceAccessPolicies.name: DescribeServiceAccessPolicies
DescribeServiceAccessPolicies.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Gets the suggesters configured for a domain. A suggester enables you to display possible matches before users finish typing their queries. Can be limited to specific suggesters by name. By default, shows all suggesters and includes any pending changes to the configuration. Set the Deployed option to true to show the active configuration and exclude pending changes. For more information, see Getting Search Suggestions in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

DescribeSuggesters.name: DescribeSuggesters
DescribeSuggesters.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Tells the search domain to start indexing its documents using the latest indexing options. This operation must be invoked to activate options whose OptionStatus is RequiresIndexDocuments.

IndexDocuments.name: IndexDocuments
IndexDocuments.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Lists all search domains owned by an account.

ListDomainNames.name: ListDomainNames
ListDomainNames.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures the availability options for a domain. Enabling the Multi-AZ option expands an Amazon CloudSearch domain to an additional Availability Zone in the same Region to increase fault tolerance in the event of a service disruption. Changes to the Multi-AZ option can take about half an hour to become active. For more information, see Configuring Availability Options in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

UpdateAvailabilityOptions.name: UpdateAvailabilityOptions
UpdateAvailabilityOptions.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures scaling parameters for a domain. A domain's scaling parameters specify the desired search instance type and replication count. Amazon CloudSearch will still automatically scale your domain based on the volume of data and traffic, but not below the desired instance type and replication count. If the Multi-AZ option is enabled, these values control the resources used per Availability Zone. For more information, see Configuring Scaling Options in the Amazon CloudSearch Developer Guide.

UpdateScalingParameters.name: UpdateScalingParameters
UpdateScalingParameters.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url

methods.description: Configures the access rules that control access to the domain's document and search endpoints. For more information, see Configuring Access for an Amazon CloudSearch Domain.

UpdateServiceAccessPolicies.name: UpdateServiceAccessPolicies
UpdateServiceAccessPolicies.description: This url parameter exists only to differentiate different operations on the same url
